p: The HO system, which comprises HO-1 (inducible) and HO-2 (constitutive), which degrade heme to free iron (increased ferritin synthesis), bilirubin (antioxidant), and carbon monoxide (antiapoptotic) is critical in its primary role in cellular defense is involved in a variety of crucial physiological functions. These include cytoprotection, anti-inflammation, anti-oxidative effects, apoptosis, neuromodulation, immune-modulation, angiogenesis, and vascular regulation [ 6]. Increased levels of HO-1 expression also results from numerous forms of stress, including smoking, cytokines, hypoxia, heme, oxidative stress, heat shock, ROS, nitric oxide (NO), cAMP, and oxidized lipids [ 6].
